update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## Requirements:
* ign-math5
* libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)

## TODO:
* Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.
* Add frame semantics for model editor 
* Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. 

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

content.raw: let's include some example models and worlds in this repo using sdf 1.7 and upload some of them to ignition
content.html: let's include some example models and worlds in this repo using sdf 1.7 and upload some of them to ignition

content.raw:
the pr2 fails to load with libsdformat9 because it has mal-formed script elements

* #!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/e6d645674e8a99cb7955ce3b9a1fbe26c58c41f2/pr2/model.sdf#lines-599

I think we need to relax the strictness of the Material DOM parsing
content.html:
the pr2 fails to load with libsdformat9 because it has mal-formed script elements

  • #!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/e6d645674e8a99cb7955ce3b9a1fbe26c58c41f2/pr2/model.sdf#lines-599

I think we need to relax the strictness of the Material DOM parsing

content.raw: `return`ing here is preventing nested models from loading
content.html: returning here is preventing nested models from loading

content.raw: I'm having compilation problems because ignition-fuel-tools1 is bringing in a ign-math4 dependency somehow. Also, it looks like ignition-fuel-tools2 still uses ign-math4
content.html: I'm having compilation problems because ignition-fuel-tools1 is bringing in a ign-math4 dependency somehow. Also, it looks like ignition-fuel-tools2 still uses ign-math4

content.raw: I think we should update the ign-common dependency as well
content.html: I think we should update the ign-common dependency as well

update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## Requirements:
* ign-math5

update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics

update.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.

This PR also migrates Gazebo to ign-math5. I can split this out into its own PR once the TODOs are finished.

## Requirements:
* ign-math5
* libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)

## TODO:
* Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.
* Add frame semantics for model editor 
* Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. 

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}
update.title: [WIP] Support SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics
